sub_title: Strategic Urban Planner - Planoloog & Stedenbouwkundige bij Gemeente Amsterdam
summary:
With expertise in both spatial and transportation planning I analyze urban, regional and international issues related to public transportation and land-use, mostly in preliminary phase. Within Arcadis I advise and support clients from a broader perspective: with regards to strategic policy making, stakeholder management and business advisory. 

My current focus is on benchmarking and strategic integration policies that support adjustment between multimodal transportation networks and land-use, such as ‘Transit Oriented Development’ (TOD) or the similar Arcadis approach named 'Mobility Oriented Development' (MODe). As part of the global MODe value proposition we created the MODex, a benchmark model for comparing 21 station areas worldwide.

With experience from earlier projects I am also familiar with (1) socio-economic statistics: executing quantitative and qualitative data analyses; and (2) stakeholder management: aligning different stakeholder interests, using stakeholder analysis.

Personal interest:
I have a specific interest in socio-economic statistics and Big Data-tools that allow us to improving  socio-economic and spatial analyses (Power BI, IBM Watson). I aim for a sustainable, safe and healthy environment. My most intriguing experience was to work as a volunteer in a slum development program in India.

Specialties: 
Regional, urban & infrastructure planning, Transit Oriented Development (TOD), strategic governance, cost-benefit analyses, scenario planning (MIRT), environmental impact assessment (MER), Systems Engineering, public-private partnerships (PPP) and stakeholder management. 

Software:
Power BI, Relatics, MS Visio, MS Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint), Adobe CS6 (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator), AutoCad, ArchiCad, Revit, Microstation, Sketchup, ArcGis.

Skills: 
I am known for being an inspiring and committed team player with a broad, integral view on complex issues, eager to learn, creative, client focused and for having good analytical skills.

I volunteered in Indian slums and during my master's program I went to Buenos Aires for a globalization course. During this course I worked together with students from the University of Buenos Aires.

awards.title: Third prize winner for the development of MODex (model) and global benchmark of station areas
awards.description:
Third prize winner at the Arcadis Satellite Global Innovation Awards, Berlin. 
For the work on the development of a model to assess the quality and value of station areas worldwide, named MODex (benchmark as part of the Arcadis global value proposition called ‘Mobility Oriented Development’). The model has been used to perform the first global benchmark on 21 international station areas.

projects.title: Graduation project MSc Urbanism
projects.description:
‘Integration of transport and land-use: The case of the Leiden-Gouda area’

Theoretical and empirical research on regional development and the integration of transport and land-use at regional level, from the perspective of three dimensions: space, institutions and process. The ‘Rijngouwelijn’ in the region between Leiden and Gouda has been used as a case study. 

The research started with a preliminary study on the Dutch culture and system of spatial planning, the involved tiers of governance, their planning agencies, their legal powers and the role of semi-public and private actors. As part of the theoretical research integrated transport concepts such as ‘TOD’, strategic spatial planning models and the TIP-model for process management have been investigated. 

Spatial empirical research has been done according to mapping of the regional infrastructure and transport networks, their coherence with the programmatic functions (spatial and programmatic differentiation), spatial form, and the identification of station typologies. 

In terms of governance, empirical research has been done to investigate the issues of decision-making around the project by doing several interviews with involved participants, and by mapping the institutional structure within the region. The research was completed with three alternative design proposals for the case study, according to the three dimensions (a spatial-, institutional- and process design).
 
This has been done within the Complex Cities graduation studio (department of Spatial Planning & Strategy). Involved mentors are prof. V. Nadin & prof. dr. W. A. M. Zonneveld.

projects.title: Pre-Master Architecture
projects.description:
This educational application program forms the bridge between bachelor (BSc/HBO) and master (MSc/WO); if finished with good results, it gave direct access to the master program.
 
A convenant between the Hanze University of Applied Sciences (HBO) at Groningen and the TU Delft (WO) made it possible to follow this pre-master during our bachelors. The program was given in addition to the regular specialism in architecture, the minor period of the HBO. I've completed this program with good results, which gave me direct admission to the TU Delft.
 
Content: Architecture, Urbanism, Building Technology and Real Estate & Housing

profile_positions.title: Business Development | Smart Cities & Digital Services

profile_positions.description:
Involved in studies on spatial planning & transportation and in business advisory:

Activities:
- Bidding and tendering: writing proposals for integral studies
- Assisting with (integral) scenario and development studies in preliminary phase (MIRT - Multi-Year Programme for Infrastructure, Spatial Planning and Transport);
- Performing studies related to transportation and socio- and spatial-economic statistics;
- Performing stakeholder analysis;
- Developing models for benchmarking qualitative and quantitative data analyses;
- Developing models for measuring the quality and value of station areas;
- Executing international benchmark for station areas;
- Connecting people and knowledge around station area development, within Arcadis globally. 
- Writing for publication (e.g. papers) and joining conferences in the field of spatial planning & transportation.

Projects:
- Preliminary study – Eurekarail: Investigating opportunities for the operation of international railcorridors | (Socio-economic) analytics and consulting
- Initial case studies – Investigating the socio-economic impact of station areas (NS Stations) | (Socio-economic) analytics and consulting
- Preliminary study (MIRT Verkenning - Exploration phase) – Spatial and socio-economic analysis highway corridor study Amsterdam-Hoorn (A7-A8) | (Socio-economic) analytics and consulting
- Secondment at NS Reizgers, department of rail service development | Project management
- MJPG perceel 2 – National study on noice reduction along highways | Stakeholder management
- PHS Meteren – Boxtel | Scenario study [assistance]
- Dutch national concession on railway transportation and maintenance 2015-2025 | Review [assistance]

Internal activities:
- Development of MODex | International benchmark model for station areas
- International client event ARCADIS | Benchmark study
- Imagineers program 2015 | Arcadis European traineeship
- ARCADIS Global Shapers 2014 in Chicago | Participant

profile_positions.title: Project Manager - Secondment

profile_positions.description:
From the start at Movares involved in large and complex infrastructure projects, mostly from the perspective of Systems Engineering. Within projects I have fun in the political dynamics of decision-making, in managing the interaction between the need of the clients and the solution of the specialists and by translating this into a functional requirement specification. 

Activities:
- Managing integrality of complex projects 
- Writing CRS, SRS, public contracts
- Formulating functional requirements 
- Performing stakeholder analysis
- Analyzing requirements related to: systems, functionality, context, interfaces, stakeholders 
- Defining systems, project scope and system boundaries
- Managing and preparing aspect requirements (RAMS & risks, LCC's) 
- Interviewing specialists and government officials for writing requirements specifications

Projects:
- Multimodal freight terminal Twente | Scenario study | Cost-benefit analyses [assistance]
- Multimodal transport network region ‘FoodValley’ | Vision document | Tender [assistance]
- Public transportation corridor Amsterdam – Utrecht | Study on spatial-economic development potentials
- Station Harderwijk | System Engineering | CRS
- Elevated light rail station ‘Haags Startstation Erasmuslijn’ (HSE) | Systems Engineering | CRS, SRS, tender specification
- Railway capacity expansion Utrecht – Leidsche Rijn (UtARK) | Systems Engineering | CRS, SRS, tender specification
profile_positions.title: System Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for setting up a strategy and framework for the website of the 'Taskforce Mobiliteit en Ruimte' and the adjustment of the web content.

The Taskforce Mobiliteit en Ruimte (Mobility and Space) was concerned with the integration of policies on transportation and land-use, such as Transit Oriented Development (TOD). The following representatives participated in the taskforce:  

- APPM Management Consultants
- Bureau Noordzuiden
- College van Rijksadviseurs (Rijksoverheid)
- Goudappel Coffeng
- Grontmij
- Movares
- Nederlandse Organisatie voor Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek (NWO)
- Vereniging Deltametropool

profile_positions.title: Property Supervisor

profile_positions.description: For a period of 2,5 months I gave English lessons to young children in the slums of Hospet, India. I also anticipated in a women empowerment project by giving computer lessons to young women. The work was part of a slum development program. The underlying aim was to investigate the environmental conditions of people living in slums, the cultural differences and to understand how a slum 'functions', in relation to the 'formal' urban environment.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer in Slum Development Program, English Teacher

profile_positions.description: During this internship I have worked as an architectural draftsman, assisted as architectural and urban designer in several projects by doing multiple design proposals.

I became familiar with private commmisioning, formulating program requirements and improved my design skills through modelling.

volunteer_experiences.role: Slum Development: English youth teacher & women empowernment
volunteer_experiences.description: For a period of 2,5 months I gave English lessons to young children in the slums of Hospet, India. I also anticipated in a women empowerment project by giving computer lessons to young women. My underlying aim was to investigate the environmental conditions of people living in slums, the cultural differences and to understand the social life in a slum in relation to the 'formal' urban environment.
